title: Apple Fitness+ unveils an exciting lineup of new ways to stay active in 2025
author: Apple Newsroom
excerpt: Apple Fitness+ kicks off the new year with its biggest lineup of programming, bringing users more ways to stay active and mindful in 2025.
text: opens in new window Apple Fitness+ unveils an exciting lineup of new ways to stay active and mindful in 2025 Offerings include new programs for strength, pickleball, yoga, and breath meditation, and a new collaboration with Strava Apple Fitness+ is bringing users more ways to stay active and mindful in 2025, including new workouts, an introduction to breath meditation, and a new collaboration with Strava. Apple Fitness+ kicks off the new year with its biggest lineup of programming, bringing users more ways to stay active and mindful in 2025. The service introduces a progressive strength training program designed to take the guesswork out of putting together the perfect routine, along with a conditioning program for pickleball — one of the world’s fastest-growing sports. A new workshop-style yoga program helps users improve their skills with popular peak poses, while a breath meditation program supports managing stress, boosting energy, and enhancing focus. The Artist Spotlight series features more of music’s biggest stars, including Janet Jackson, Coldplay, Bruno Mars, and Kendrick Lamar, while new Time to Walk episodes feature Adam Scott, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, Tiffany Haddish, and others. Alex Wong, celebrated choreographer and dancer, leads an exclusive dance workout takeover. The new content will be available starting Monday, January 6, on iPhone, iPad, and Apple TV. And with Apple Watch, users can supercharge their experience and add a layer of extra motivation with real-time metrics to track progress. Fitness+ is also collaborating with Strava to bring a new integration to the Strava app experience, along with a special Fitness+ trial offer for Strava subscribers, and celebrated athletes from the Strava community will appear as guests in workouts. “Fitness+ is designed to support everyone’s unique fitness and wellness journey, providing welcoming and motivating workouts, meditations, and programs that make it easy to stay active and mindful,” said Jay Blahnik, Apple’s vice president of Fitness Technologies. “From workouts that can boost power and precision for pickleball, to breath meditations that help relieve stress, along with Artist Spotlight sessions featuring iconic hits, and an exciting collaboration with Strava, Fitness+ has something to inspire, motivate, and help everyone feel their best in 2025.” Three Perfect Weeks of Strength Fitness+ unveils an all-new progressive strength program that guides users through the process of building and maintaining strength, with a focus on efficiency. The three-week guided program targets every major muscle group with 12 30-minute workouts: Progressive Overload (Week One), Time Under Tension (Week Two), and Dynamic Power (Week Three). Designed for results and repeatability, this foundational fitness routine is one that users can return to, adjusting weights as they grow stronger. Three Perfect Weeks of Strength guides users through the process of building and maintaining strength, with a focus on efficiency. Strength, Endurance, and Agility for Pickleball Pickleball is one of the world’s fastest-growing sports, beloved by casual and competitive players alike. Fitness+ now offers a Strength, Endurance, and Agility for Pickleball program featuring professional pickleball champion Catherine Parenteau, who has been ranked No. 1 in the world in both singles and doubles. The program includes a mix of exercises inspired by Parenteau’s own training regimen, all designed to help users feel confident and perform their best on the court. Strength, Endurance, and Agility for Pickleball features exercises inspired by pickleball champion Catherine Parenteau’s own training regimen. Yoga Peak Poses Yoga Peak Poses brings an intimate workshop-style experience directly to users wherever they are, with an attention to form and education typically found in a one-on-one session. Each session spotlights a single peak pose — including Dancer, Twisted Hand to Big Toe, and Crow — to provide users with focused time and instruction to build confidence and skill. For each pose, there is a 10-minute prep flow to warm users up for the corresponding 10-minute practice session. Yoga Peak Poses immerses users in an intimate workshop-style experience wherever they are, spotlighting a single peak pose in every session. Introduction to Breath Meditation The new Introduction to Breath Meditation program teaches powerful, easy-to-follow techniques for managing stress, boosting energy, and enhancing focus. Users can choose from five 10-minute meditations — like belly, box, and ocean breathing — to relax, recharge, or refocus. Additionally, Breath is now a theme within Fitness+, bringing the total to 12 unique meditation themes, including Calm, Sleep, and Sound. These themes make it even simpler for users to find meditation practices that suit their lifestyle. Introduction to Breath Meditation teaches powerful, easy-to-follow techniques for managing stress, boosting energy, and enhancing focus. Spotlight on Music’s Biggest Stars The Artist Spotlight series, which dedicates entire workout playlists to a single artist, returns with new workouts featuring music from some of the world’s biggest artists. Upcoming featured artists include Janet Jackson (starting January 13), Coldplay (starting January 20), Bruno Mars (starting January 27), and Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show headliner Kendrick Lamar (starting February 3). Each playlist is crafted to fuel workouts across different types of training, from Cycling and HIIT to Strength and Dance, adding a new level of energy to every move. Janet Jackson’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16. Coldplay’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16. Bruno Mars’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16. Kendrick Lamar’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16. The Artist Spotlight series returns with workouts featuring music from Janet Jackson (January 13), Coldplay (January 20), Bruno Mars (January 27), and Kendrick Lamar (February 3). The Artist Spotlight series returns with workouts featuring music from Janet Jackson (January 13), Coldplay (January 20), Bruno Mars (January 27), and Kendrick Lamar (February 3). The Artist Spotlight series returns with workouts featuring music from Janet Jackson (January 13), Coldplay (January 20), Bruno Mars (January 27), and Kendrick Lamar (February 3). The Artist Spotlight series returns with workouts featuring music from Janet Jackson (January 13), Coldplay (January 20), Bruno Mars (January 27), and Kendrick Lamar (February 3). New Episodes of Time to Walk Time to Walk — an award-winning audio experience on iPhone and Apple Watch designed to help people walk more often — allows users to walk alongside some of the world’s most interesting and influential people as they share stories, photos, and songs. New episodes begin January 13 with award-winning actor and comedian Adam Scott, who stars in the highly anticipated new season of Severance, premiering January 17 exclusively on Apple TV+. Adam Scott’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Steve Aoki’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Lana Condor’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Tiffany Haddish’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Rita Ora’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Daddy Yankee’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. Maddie Ziegler’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. The new season of Time to Walk kicks off January 13, featuring Adam Scott, Steve Aoki, Lana Condor, Tiffany Haddish, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, and Maddie Ziegler. Other episodes this season feature two-time GRAMMY-nominated artist and record producer Steve Aoki; award-winning actor and producer Lana Condor; actor and singer Tiffany Haddish; global award-winning singer, songwriter, and actor Rita Ora; award-winning Latin urban artist Daddy Yankee; and actor, producer, and dancer Maddie Ziegler. Guest Trainer Alex Wong Professional choreographer, dancer, and So You Think You Can Dance all-star Alex Wong brings his world-class talent to Fitness+ in an exclusive workout takeover. In a special 20-minute Dance workout, Wong leads high-energy, motivating routines for all levels alongside Fitness+ trainers. So You Think You Can Dance all-star Alex Wong brings his world-class talent to Fitness+ in an exclusive workout takeover. Fitness+ Teams Up with Strava Fitness+ is collaborating with Strava, the app for active people, to bring a new integration to the Strava experience, and a special offer to Strava subscribers. With the enhanced integration, when members share a Fitness+ workout to Strava, the Strava app will now display rich details — including the episode image, episode number, music genre, trainer name, and metrics — to track their fitness journey and share with their community on Strava. New and existing Strava subscribers can also redeem up to three months of Fitness+ at no cost, and take advantage of the largest library of 4K Ultra High Definition fitness and wellness content in the world, with over 6,500 workouts and meditations across 12 workout types to support their training.1 Additionally, celebrated athletes from the Strava community will join the Fitness+ trainer team as special guests in workouts throughout the year. With a new integration to the Strava experience, members can share a Fitness+ workout to the Strava app, and it will display rich details, including the episode image, episode number, music genre, trainer name, and metrics. Ring In the New Year with Apple Watch To kick off the new year, Apple Watch users can earn a limited-edition award when they close all three Activity rings for seven days in a row in January. In January, Apple Watch users can earn a limited-edition award when they close all three Activity rings for seven days in a row. Apple Fitness+ is available as a subscription service for $9.99 (U.S.) per month or $79.99 (U.S.) per year, and can be shared with up to five other family members. Fitness+ is included in the Apple One Premier plan, which, where available, also gives customers access to Apple Music, Apple TV+, Apple Arcade, Apple News+, and iCloud+ with 2TB of storage, and can be shared with up to five other family members. Fitness+ is available in Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Colombia, France, Germany, Indonesia, Ireland, Italy, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Portugal, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Spain, Switzerland, the UAE, the U.K., and the U.S. Three months of Apple Fitness+ are included for customers who purchase Apple Watch Series 4 or later, iPhone 11 or later, iPad (9th generation) or later, iPad Air (5th generation) or later, iPad mini (6th generation) or later, 11-inch iPad Pro (3rd generation) or later, 12.9-inch iPad Pro (5th generation) or later, Apple TV HD, or Apple TV 4K (2nd generation). One month of Fitness+ is included for all other new subscribers. Apple Fitness+ requires iPhone 8 or later with iOS 16.1 or later, or Apple Watch Series 3 or later with watchOS 7.2 or later paired with iPhone 6s or later with iOS 14.3 or later. The new integration of Fitness+ workouts in the Strava app requires the latest version of the Strava app, and iPhone running iOS 18.2. Strava users with an Apple Watch will need to update to watchOS 11.2. Starting today, Strava subscribers can redeem two months in addition to the free one-month trial offered to new Fitness+ users, for a total of three months. This offer will be available beginning in Australia, Canada, the U.K., and the U.S. See strava.com for details.
html:
opens in new window

Apple Fitness+ unveils an exciting lineup of new ways to stay active and mindful in 2025

Offerings include new programs for strength, pickleball, yoga, and breath meditation, and a new collaboration with Strava
Apple Fitness+ kicks off the new year with its biggest lineup of programming, bringing users more ways to stay active and mindful in 2025. The service introduces a progressive strength training program designed to take the guesswork out of putting together the perfect routine, along with a conditioning program for pickleball — one of the world’s fastest-growing sports. A new workshop-style yoga program helps users improve their skills with popular peak poses, while a breath meditation program supports managing stress, boosting energy, and enhancing focus. The Artist Spotlight series features more of music’s biggest stars, including Janet Jackson, Coldplay, Bruno Mars, and Kendrick Lamar, while new Time to Walk episodes feature Adam Scott, Rita Ora, Daddy Yankee, Tiffany Haddish, and others. Alex Wong, celebrated choreographer and dancer, leads an exclusive dance workout takeover.
The new content will be available starting Monday, January 6, on iPhone, iPad, and Apple TV. And with Apple Watch, users can supercharge their experience and add a layer of extra motivation with real-time metrics to track progress. Fitness+ is also collaborating with Strava to bring a new integration to the Strava app experience, along with a special Fitness+ trial offer for Strava subscribers, and celebrated athletes from the Strava community will appear as guests in workouts.
“Fitness+ is designed to support everyone’s unique fitness and wellness journey, providing welcoming and motivating workouts, meditations, and programs that make it easy to stay active and mindful,” said Jay Blahnik, Apple’s vice president of Fitness Technologies. “From workouts that can boost power and precision for pickleball, to breath meditations that help relieve stress, along with Artist Spotlight sessions featuring iconic hits, and an exciting collaboration with Strava, Fitness+ has something to inspire, motivate, and help everyone feel their best in 2025.”

Three Perfect Weeks of Strength

Fitness+ unveils an all-new progressive strength program that guides users through the process of building and maintaining strength, with a focus on efficiency. The three-week guided program targets every major muscle group with 12 30-minute workouts: Progressive Overload (Week One), Time Under Tension (Week Two), and Dynamic Power (Week Three). Designed for results and repeatability, this foundational fitness routine is one that users can return to, adjusting weights as they grow stronger.

Strength, Endurance, and Agility for Pickleball

Pickleball is one of the world’s fastest-growing sports, beloved by casual and competitive players alike. Fitness+ now offers a Strength, Endurance, and Agility for Pickleball program featuring professional pickleball champion Catherine Parenteau, who has been ranked No. 1 in the world in both singles and doubles. The program includes a mix of exercises inspired by Parenteau’s own training regimen, all designed to help users feel confident and perform their best on the court.

Yoga Peak Poses

Yoga Peak Poses brings an intimate workshop-style experience directly to users wherever they are, with an attention to form and education typically found in a one-on-one session. Each session spotlights a single peak pose — including Dancer, Twisted Hand to Big Toe, and Crow — to provide users with focused time and instruction to build confidence and skill. For each pose, there is a 10-minute prep flow to warm users up for the corresponding 10-minute practice session.

Introduction to Breath Meditation

The new Introduction to Breath Meditation program teaches powerful, easy-to-follow techniques for managing stress, boosting energy, and enhancing focus. Users can choose from five 10-minute meditations — like belly, box, and ocean breathing — to relax, recharge, or refocus. Additionally, Breath is now a theme within Fitness+, bringing the total to 12 unique meditation themes, including Calm, Sleep, and Sound. These themes make it even simpler for users to find meditation practices that suit their lifestyle.

Spotlight on Music’s Biggest Stars

The Artist Spotlight series, which dedicates entire workout playlists to a single artist, returns with new workouts featuring music from some of the world’s biggest artists. Upcoming featured artists include Janet Jackson (starting January 13), Coldplay (starting January 20), Bruno Mars (starting January 27), and Apple Music Super Bowl LIX Halftime Show headliner Kendrick Lamar (starting February 3). Each playlist is crafted to fuel workouts across different types of training, from Cycling and HIIT to Strength and Dance, adding a new level of energy to every move.
  • Janet Jackson’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16.
  • Coldplay’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16.
  • Bruno Mars’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16.
  • Kendrick Lamar’s Artist Spotlight workout in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16.

New Episodes of Time to Walk

Time to Walk — an award-winning audio experience on iPhone and Apple Watch designed to help people walk more often — allows users to walk alongside some of the world’s most interesting and influential people as they share stories, photos, and songs. New episodes begin January 13 with award-winning actor and comedian Adam Scott, who stars in the highly anticipated new season of Severance, premiering January 17 exclusively on Apple TV+.
  • Adam Scott’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Steve Aoki’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Lana Condor’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Tiffany Haddish’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Rita Ora’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Daddy Yankee’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
  • Maddie Ziegler’s Time to Walk episode in Apple Fitness+ is shown on iPhone 16 and Apple Watch.
Other episodes this season feature two-time GRAMMY-nominated artist and record producer Steve Aoki; award-winning actor and producer Lana Condor; actor and singer Tiffany Haddish; global award-winning singer, songwriter, and actor Rita Ora; award-winning Latin urban artist Daddy Yankee; and actor, producer, and dancer Maddie Ziegler.

Guest Trainer Alex Wong

Professional choreographer, dancer, and So You Think You Can Dance all-star Alex Wong brings his world-class talent to Fitness+ in an exclusive workout takeover. In a special 20-minute Dance workout, Wong leads high-energy, motivating routines for all levels alongside Fitness+ trainers.

Fitness+ Teams Up with Strava

Fitness+ is collaborating with Strava, the app for active people, to bring a new integration to the Strava experience, and a special offer to Strava subscribers. With the enhanced integration, when members share a Fitness+ workout to Strava, the Strava app will now display rich details — including the episode image, episode number, music genre, trainer name, and metrics — to track their fitness journey and share with their community on Strava. New and existing Strava subscribers can also redeem up to three months of Fitness+ at no cost, and take advantage of the largest library of 4K Ultra High Definition fitness and wellness content in the world, with over 6,500 workouts and meditations across 12 workout types to support their training.1 Additionally, celebrated athletes from the Strava community will join the Fitness+ trainer team as special guests in workouts throughout the year.

Ring In the New Year with Apple Watch

To kick off the new year, Apple Watch users can earn a limited-edition award when they close all three Activity rings for seven days in a row in January.
  • Apple Fitness+ is available as a subscription service for $9.99 (U.S.) per month or $79.99 (U.S.) per year, and can be shared with up to five other family members.
  • Fitness+ is included in the Apple One Premier plan, which, where available, also gives customers access to Apple Music, Apple TV+, Apple Arcade, Apple News+, and iCloud+ with 2TB of storage, and can be shared with up to five other family members.
  • Fitness+ is available in Australia, Austria, Brazil, Canada, Colombia, France, Germany, Indonesia, Ireland, Italy, Malaysia, Mexico, New Zealand, Portugal, Russia, Saudi Arabia, Spain, Switzerland, the UAE, the U.K., and the U.S.
  • Three months of Apple Fitness+ are included for customers who purchase Apple Watch Series 4 or later, iPhone 11 or later, iPad (9th generation) or later, iPad Air (5th generation) or later, iPad mini (6th generation) or later, 11-inch iPad Pro (3rd generation) or later, 12.9-inch iPad Pro (5th generation) or later, Apple TV HD, or Apple TV 4K (2nd generation). One month of Fitness+ is included for all other new subscribers.
  • Apple Fitness+ requires iPhone 8 or later with iOS 16.1 or later, or Apple Watch Series 3 or later with watchOS 7.2 or later paired with iPhone 6s or later with iOS 14.3 or later.
  • The new integration of Fitness+ workouts in the Strava app requires the latest version of the Strava app, and iPhone running iOS 18.2. Strava users with an Apple Watch will need to update to watchOS 11.2.
  1. Starting today, Strava subscribers can redeem two months in addition to the free one-month trial offered to new Fitness+ users, for a total of three months. This offer will be available beginning in Australia, Canada, the U.K., and the U.S. See strava.com for details.
